ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This course is a both a broad survey of history, visual art, and literature, and something much more deep, serious, and engaging. This course offers historical and thematic arcs for understanding the black female body, but it also pushes you to deconstruct the ways of knowing ingrained in how we perceive, analyze, or describe the visual or textual field.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course deepened my sense of disciplines and their histories, and gave me a critical set of tools that stretched beyond any given discipline or professional way of encountering or producing knowledge. I found this course to be a very useful space for thinking deeply about the relationship of culture to meaning and history.
